<p>We’re really proud of what <strong>Eurogamer</strong> has to say about <strong><em>KSP</em></strong> in their early access <strong><a href="http://bit.ly/1aMVvlb" target="_blank">review</a></strong> of the game.<br/><br/><em>"It is, already, the sort of game you could play for 100 hours without exhausting its potential and yet, even when you’re pootling around with doomed-to-fail contraptions, taking the most basic introductory steps, it’s never less than charming, engrossing and entertaining. That you can go from such humble beginnings to explore an entire realistically crafted solar system is nothing short of remarkable. Strap yourself in. It’s going to be a long and wonderful ride.Ã¢â‚¬Â<br/></em><br/> Read the rest of <strong>Eurogamer</strong>'s review right <strong><a href="http://bit.ly/1aMVvlb" target="_blank">HERE</a></strong>.</p>

Congrats! I vouch for everything written ... it's one of the best PC games of all time. But I'm not sure about the 100 hours comment ... I'm fast-approaching 1000 hours (according to Steam) and I still haven't exhausted myself!
Psh, 100 hours is just for beginners. XD

Psh, 100 hours is just for beginners. XD

For me, every hour logged = two forum posts. Do the math.
3.167 per post roughly. But, yeah I do agree one can sink hours upon hours into the game. Expecially when you play with rovers and planes.
I don't log how much time I have in the game, but I think it's over 500 at least.
I'm sure I've sunk a thousand hours...

I enjoy how the only thing anyone takes anything resembling offense at is the estimate on how long the game can keep you engaged.

(Yeah, I've been playing this thing since early November of 2011 for around 2 hours per day average. That works out to way too many hours; best estimate pegs it around 1,600 and that's probably low-balling it.)

Hard for me to say how many hours I've played (wife says "too much. " Though Steam keeps track, I often leave the game running over night or when I'm at work to scan for kethane and elevation/biome using mods.
I've played nearly 200 hours and I'm only starting to really appreciate the full potential of this game...
